Border draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p>\n All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the\n drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left.\n </p>\n<p>\n Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area,\n therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction.\n </p>\n<p>\n<code>borderWidthBefore</code> and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> parameters are used to\n define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for\n the bottom border, <code>borderWidthBefore</code> specifies width of the right border and\n <code>borderWidthAfter</code> - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas\n of border joins.\n </p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/Border.html

Canvas close	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Closes the <a href="../../../com/itextpdf/layout/Canvas.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout"><code>Canvas</code></a>. Although not completely necessary in all cases, it is still recommended to call this\n method when you are done working with <a href="../../../com/itextpdf/layout/Canvas.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout"><code>Canvas</code></a> object, as due to some properties set there might be some\n 'hanging' elements, which are waiting other elements to be added and processed. <a href="../../../com/itextpdf/layout/Canvas.html#close--"><code>close()</code></a> tells the\n <a href="../../../com/itextpdf/layout/Canvas.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout"><code>Canvas</code></a> that no more elements will be added and it is time to finish processing all the elements.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/Canvas.html

CFFFontSubset	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This Class subsets a CFF Type Font. The subset is preformed for CID fonts and NON CID fonts.\n The Charstring is subsetted for both types. For CID fonts only the FDArray which are used are embedded.\n The Lsubroutines of the FDArrays used are subsetted as well. The Subroutine subset supports both Type1 and Type2\n formatting although only tested on Type2 Format.\n For Non CID the Lsubroutines are subsetted. On both types the Gsubroutines is subsetted.\n A font which was not of CID type is transformed into CID as a part of the subset process.\n The CID synthetic creation was written by Sivan Toledo (sivan@math.tau.ac.il)</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CFFFontSubset.html

CompareTool compareByCatalog	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Compares two PDF documents by content starting from Catalog dictionary and then recursively comparing\n corresponding objects which are referenced from it. You can roughly imagine it as depth-first traversal\n of the two trees that represent pdf objects structure of the documents.\n <br/><br/>\n The main difference between this method and the <a href="../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareByContent-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-"><code>compareByContent(String, String, String, String)</code></a>\n methods is the return value. This method returns a <a href="../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.CompareResult.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils"><code>CompareTool.CompareResult</code></a> class instance, which could be used\n in code, however compareByContent methods in case of the differences simply return String value, which could\n only be printed. Also, keep in mind that this method doesn't perform visual comparison of the documents.\n <br/><br/>\n For more explanations about what is outDoc and cmpDoc see last paragraph of the <a href="../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils"><code>CompareTool</code></a>\n class description.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html
CompareTool disableCachedPagesComparison	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Disables the default logic of pages comparison.\n This option makes sense only for <a href="../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareByCatalog-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>compareByCatalog(PdfDocument, PdfDocument)</code></a> method.\n <p>\n By default, pages are treated as special objects and if they are met in the process of comparison, then they are\n not checked as objects, but rather simply checked that they has same page numbers in both documents.\n This behaviour is intended for the <a href="../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareByContent-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-"><code>compareByContent(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)</code></a>\n set of methods, because in them documents are compared in page by page basis. Thus, we don't need to check if pages\n are of the same content when they are met in comparison process, we are sure that we will compare their content or\n we have already compared them.\n <p>\n However, if you would use <a href="../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareByCatalog-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>compareByCatalog(com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument, com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument)</code></a> with default behaviour\n of pages comparison, pages won't be checked at all, every time when reference to the page dictionary is met,\n only page numbers will be compared for both documents. You can say that in this case, comparison will be performed\n for all document's catalog entries except /Pages (However in fact, document's page tree structures will be compared,\n but pages themselves - won't).</p></p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html

CompareTool compareVisually	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Compares two documents visually. For the comparison two external tools are used: Ghostscript and ImageMagick.\n For more info about needed configuration for visual comparison process see <a href="../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils"><code>CompareTool</code></a> class description.\n <br/>\n During comparison for every page of two documents an image file will be created in the folder specified by\n outPath absolute path. Then those page images will be compared and if there are any differences for some pages,\n another image file will be created with marked differences on it.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html
CompareTool compareVisually	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Compares two documents visually. For the comparison two external tools are used: Ghostscript and ImageMagick.\n For more info about needed configuration for visual comparison process see <a href="../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils"><code>CompareTool</code></a> class description.\n <br/>\n During comparison for every page of two documents an image file will be created in the folder specified by\n outPath absolute path. Then those page images will be compared and if there are any differences for some pages,\n another image file will be created with marked differences on it.\n <br/>\n It is possible to ignore certain areas of the document pages during visual comparison. This is useful for example\n in case if documents should be the same except certain page area with date on it. In this case, in the folder\n specified by the outPath, new pdf documents will be created with the black rectangles at the specified ignored\n areas, and visual comparison will be performed on these new documents.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html
CompareTool compareByContent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Compares two PDF documents by content starting from page dictionaries and then recursively comparing\n corresponding objects which are referenced from them. You can roughly imagine it as depth-first traversal\n of the two trees that represent pdf objects structure of the documents.\n <br/><br/>\n Unlike <a href="../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareByCatalog-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>compareByCatalog(PdfDocument, PdfDocument)</code></a> this method performs content comparison page by page\n and doesn't compare the tag structure, acroforms and all other things that doesn't belong to specific pages.\n <br/>\n When comparison by content is finished, if any differences were found, visual comparison is automatically started.\n For more info see <a href="../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html#compareVisually-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-"><code>compareVisually(String, String, String, String)</code></a>.\n <br/><br/>\n For more explanations about what is outPdf and cmpPdf see last paragraph of the <a href="../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/CompareTool.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.utils"><code>CompareTool</code></a>\n class description.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html

CompareTool	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class provides means to compare two PDF files both by content and visually\n and gives the report of their differences.\n \n For visual comparison it uses external tools: Ghostscript and ImageMagick, which\n should be installed on your machine. To allow CompareTool to use them, you need\n to pass either java properties or environment variables with names "gsExec" and\n "compareExec", which would contain the paths to the executables of correspondingly\n Ghostscript and ImageMagick tools.\n \n CompareTool class was mainly designed for the testing purposes of iText in order to\n ensure that the same code produces the same PDF document. For this reason you will\n often encounter such parameter names as "outDoc" and "cmpDoc" which stand for output\n document and document-for-comparison. The first one is viewed as the current result,\n and the second one is referred as normal or ideal result. OutDoc is compared to the\n ideal cmpDoc. Therefore all reports of the comparison are in the form: "Expected ...,\n but was ...". This should be interpreted in the following way: "expected" part stands\n for the content of the cmpDoc and "but was" part stands for the content of the outDoc.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html

DashedBorder draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p>\n All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the\n drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left.\n </p>\n<p>\n Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area,\n therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction.\n </p>\n<p>\n<code>borderWidthBefore</code> and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> parameters are used to\n define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for\n the bottom border, <code>borderWidthBefore</code> specifies width of the right border and\n <code>borderWidthAfter</code> - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas\n of border joins.\n </p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/DashedBorder.html

Document	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Document is the default root element when creating a self-sufficient PDF. It\n mainly operates high-level operations e.g. setting page size and rotation,\n adding elements, and writing text at specific coordinates. It has no\n knowledge of the actual PDF concepts and syntax.\n \n A Document's rendering behavior can be modified by extending\n DocumentRenderer and setting an instance of this newly created with\n setRenderer(com.itextpdf.layout.renderer.DocumentRenderer).</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/Document.html

DottedBorder draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p>\n All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the\n drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left.\n </p>\n<p>\n Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area,\n therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction.\n </p>\n<p>\n<code>borderWidthBefore</code> and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> parameters are used to\n define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for\n the bottom border, <code>borderWidthBefore</code> specifies width of the right border and\n <code>borderWidthAfter</code> - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas\n of border joins.\n </p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/DottedBorder.html

FilteredEventListener FilteredEventListener	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Constructs a <a href="../../../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/parser/listener/FilteredEventListener.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.listener"><code>FilteredEventListener</code></a> empty instance.\n Use <a href="../../../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/parser/listener/FilteredEventListener.html#attachEventListener-T-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.filter.IEventFilter...-"><code>attachEventListener(IEventListener, IEventFilter...)</code></a> to add an event listener along with its filters.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FilteredEventListener.html
FilteredEventListener attachEventListener	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Attaches another <a href="../../../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/parser/listener/IEventListener.html" title="interface in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.listener"><code>IEventListener</code></a> delegate with its filters.\n When all the filters attached to the delegate for an event accept the event, the event will be passed on to\n the delegate.\n You can attach multiple delegates to this <a href="../../../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/parser/listener/FilteredEventListener.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.listener"><code>FilteredEventListener</code></a> instance. The content stream will\n be parsed just once, so it is better for performance than creating multiple <a href="../../../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/parser/listener/FilteredEventListener.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.parser.listener"><code>FilteredEventListener</code></a>\n instances and parsing the content stream multiple times. This is useful, for instance, when you want\n to extract content from multiple regions of a page.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FilteredEventListener.html

FontProgramFactory createFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a new font. This will always be the default Helvetica font (not embedded).\n This method is introduced because Helvetica is used in many examples.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FontProgramFactory.html
FontProgramFactory createFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a new font. This font can be one of the 14 built in types,\n a Type1 font referred to by an AFM or PFM file, a TrueType font (simple or collection) or a CJK font from the\n Adobe Asian Font Pack. TrueType fonts and CJK fonts can have an optional style modifier\n appended to the name. These modifiers are: Bold, Italic and BoldItalic. An\n example would be "STSong-Light,Bold". Note that this modifiers do not work if\n the font is embedded. Fonts in TrueType collections are addressed by index such as "msgothic.ttc,1".\n This would get the second font (indexes start at 0), in this case "MS PGothic".\n <p></p>\n The fonts are cached and if they already exist they are extracted from the cache,\n not parsed again.\n <p></p>\n Besides the common encodings described by name, custom encodings\n can also be made. These encodings will only work for the single byte fonts\n Type1 and TrueType. The encoding string starts with a '#'\n followed by "simple" or "full". If "simple" there is a decimal for the first character position and then a list\n of hex values representing the Unicode codes that compose that encoding.<br>\n The "simple" encoding is recommended for TrueType fonts\n as the "full" encoding risks not matching the character with the right glyph\n if not done with care.<br>\n The "full" encoding is specially aimed at Type1 fonts where the glyphs have to be\n described by non standard names like the Tex math fonts. Each group of three elements\n compose a code position: the one byte code order in decimal or as 'x' (x cannot be the space), the name and the Unicode character\n used to access the glyph. The space must be assigned to character position 32 otherwise\n text justification will not work.\n <p></p>\n Example for a "simple" encoding that includes the Unicode\n character space, A, B and ecyrillic:\n <pre>\n "# simple 32 0020 0041 0042 0454"\n </pre>\n<p></p>\n Example for a "full" encoding for a Type1 Tex font:\n <pre>\n "# full 'A' nottriangeqlleft 0041 'B' dividemultiply 0042 32 space 0020"\n </pre>\n<p></p>\n This method calls:<br>\n<pre>\n createFont(name, null, true);\n </pre></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FontProgramFactory.html
FontProgramFactory createFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a new font. This font can be one of the 14 built in types,\n a Type1 font referred to by an AFM or PFM file, a TrueType font (simple or collection) or a CJK font from the\n Adobe Asian Font Pack. TrueType fonts and CJK fonts can have an optional style modifier\n appended to the name. These modifiers are: Bold, Italic and BoldItalic. An\n example would be "STSong-Light,Bold". Note that this modifiers do not work if\n the font is embedded. Fonts in TrueType collections are addressed by index such as "msgothic.ttc,1".\n This would get the second font (indexes start at 0), in this case "MS PGothic".\n <p></p>\n The fonts are cached and if they already exist they are extracted from the cache,\n not parsed again.\n <p></p>\n Besides the common encodings described by name, custom encodings\n can also be made. These encodings will only work for the single byte fonts\n Type1 and TrueType. The encoding string starts with a '#'\n followed by "simple" or "full". If "simple" there is a decimal for the first character position and then a list\n of hex values representing the Unicode codes that compose that encoding.<br>\n The "simple" encoding is recommended for TrueType fonts\n as the "full" encoding risks not matching the character with the right glyph\n if not done with care.<br>\n The "full" encoding is specially aimed at Type1 fonts where the glyphs have to be\n described by non standard names like the Tex math fonts. Each group of three elements\n compose a code position: the one byte code order in decimal or as 'x' (x cannot be the space), the name and the Unicode character\n used to access the glyph. The space must be assigned to character position 32 otherwise\n text justification will not work.\n <p></p>\n Example for a "simple" encoding that includes the Unicode\n character space, A, B and ecyrillic:\n <pre>\n "# simple 32 0020 0041 0042 0454"\n </pre>\n<p></p>\n Example for a "full" encoding for a Type1 Tex font:\n <pre>\n "# full 'A' nottriangeqlleft 0041 'B' dividemultiply 0042 32 space 0020"\n </pre>\n<p></p>\n This method calls:<br>\n<pre>\n createFont(name, encoding, embedded, true, null, null);\n </pre></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FontProgramFactory.html
FontProgramFactory createFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a new font. This font can be one of the 14 built in types,\n a Type1 font referred to by an AFM or PFM file, a TrueType font (simple or collection) or a CJK font from the\n Adobe Asian Font Pack. TrueType fonts and CJK fonts can have an optional style modifier\n appended to the name. These modifiers are: Bold, Italic and BoldItalic. An\n example would be "STSong-Light,Bold". Note that this modifiers do not work if\n the font is embedded. Fonts in TrueType collections are addressed by index such as "msgothic.ttc,1".\n This would get the second font (indexes start at 0), in this case "MS PGothic".\n <p></p>\n Besides the common encodings described by name, custom encodings\n can also be made. These encodings will only work for the single byte fonts\n Type1 and TrueType. The encoding string starts with a '#'\n followed by "simple" or "full". If "simple" there is a decimal for the first character position and then a list\n of hex values representing the Unicode codes that compose that encoding.<br>\n The "simple" encoding is recommended for TrueType fonts\n as the "full" encoding risks not matching the character with the right glyph\n if not done with care.<br>\n The "full" encoding is specially aimed at Type1 fonts where the glyphs have to be\n described by non standard names like the Tex math fonts. Each group of three elements\n compose a code position: the one byte code order in decimal or as 'x' (x cannot be the space), the name and the Unicode character\n used to access the glyph. The space must be assigned to character position 32 otherwise\n text justification will not work.\n <p></p>\n Example for a "simple" encoding that includes the Unicode\n character space, A, B and ecyrillic:\n <pre>\n "# simple 32 0020 0041 0042 0454"\n </pre>\n<p></p>\n Example for a "full" encoding for a Type1 Tex font:\n <pre>\n "# full 'A' nottriangeqlleft 0041 'B' dividemultiply 0042 32 space 0020"\n </pre></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FontProgramFactory.html
FontProgramFactory createFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a new font. This font can be one of the 14 built in types,\n a Type1 font referred to by an AFM or PFM file, a TrueType font (simple or collection) or a CJK font from the\n Adobe Asian Font Pack. TrueType fonts and CJK fonts can have an optional style modifier\n appended to the name. These modifiers are: Bold, Italic and BoldItalic. An\n example would be "STSong-Light,Bold". Note that this modifiers do not work if\n the font is embedded. Fonts in TrueType collections are addressed by index such as "msgothic.ttc,1".\n This would get the second font (indexes start at 0), in this case "MS PGothic".\n <p></p>\n The fonts may or may not be cached depending on the flag <code>cached</code>.\n If the <code>byte</code> arrays are present the font will be\n read from them instead of the name. A name is still required to identify\n the font type.\n <p></p>\n Besides the common encodings described by name, custom encodings\n can also be made. These encodings will only work for the single byte fonts\n Type1 and TrueType. The encoding string starts with a '#'\n followed by "simple" or "full". If "simple" there is a decimal for the first character position and then a list\n of hex values representing the Unicode codes that compose that encoding.<br>\n The "simple" encoding is recommended for TrueType fonts\n as the "full" encoding risks not matching the character with the right glyph\n if not done with care.<br>\n The "full" encoding is specially aimed at Type1 fonts where the glyphs have to be\n described by non standard names like the Tex math fonts. Each group of three elements\n compose a code position: the one byte code order in decimal or as 'x' (x cannot be the space), the name and the Unicode character\n used to access the glyph. The space must be assigned to character position 32 otherwise\n text justification will not work.\n <p></p>\n Example for a "simple" encoding that includes the Unicode\n character space, A, B and ecyrillic:\n <pre>\n "# simple 32 0020 0041 0042 0454"\n </pre>\n<p></p>\n Example for a "full" encoding for a Type1 Tex font:\n <pre>\n "# full 'A' nottriangeqlleft 0041 'B' dividemultiply 0042 32 space 0020"\n </pre></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FontProgramFactory.html
FontProgramFactory createType1Font	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a new font. This font can be one of the 14 built in types,\n a Type1 font referred to by an AFM or PFM file, a TrueType font (simple or collection) or a CJK font from the\n Adobe Asian Font Pack. TrueType fonts and CJK fonts can have an optional style modifier\n appended to the name. These modifiers are: Bold, Italic and BoldItalic. An\n example would be "STSong-Light,Bold". Note that this modifiers do not work if\n the font is embedded. Fonts in TrueType collections are addressed by index such as "msgothic.ttc,1".\n This would get the second font (indexes start at 0), in this case "MS PGothic".\n <p></p>\n The fonts may or may not be cached depending on the flag <code>cached</code>.\n If the <code>byte</code> arrays are present the font will be\n read from them instead of the name. A name is still required to identify\n the font type.\n <p></p>\n Besides the common encodings described by name, custom encodings\n can also be made. These encodings will only work for the single byte fonts\n Type1 and TrueType. The encoding string starts with a '#'\n followed by "simple" or "full". If "simple" there is a decimal for the first character position and then a list\n of hex values representing the Unicode codes that compose that encoding.<br>\n The "simple" encoding is recommended for TrueType fonts\n as the "full" encoding risks not matching the character with the right glyph\n if not done with care.<br>\n The "full" encoding is specially aimed at Type1 fonts where the glyphs have to be\n described by non standard names like the Tex math fonts. Each group of three elements\n compose a code position: the one byte code order in decimal or as 'x' (x cannot be the space), the name and the Unicode character\n used to access the glyph. The space must be assigned to character position 32 otherwise\n text justification will not work.\n <p></p>\n Example for a "simple" encoding that includes the Unicode\n character space, A, B and ecyrillic:\n <pre>\n "# simple 32 0020 0041 0042 0454"\n </pre>\n<p></p>\n Example for a "full" encoding for a Type1 Tex font:\n <pre>\n "# full 'A' nottriangeqlleft 0041 'B' dividemultiply 0042 32 space 0020"\n </pre></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FontProgramFactory.html
FontProgramFactory createFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a new True Type font from ttc file,\n <p></p>\n The fonts may or may not be cached depending on the flag <code>cached</code>.\n If the <code>byte</code> arrays are present the font will be\n read from them instead of the name. A name is still required to identify\n the font type.\n <p></p>\n Besides the common encodings described by name, custom encodings\n can also be made. These encodings will only work for the single byte fonts\n Type1 and TrueType. The encoding string starts with a '#'\n followed by "simple" or "full". If "simple" there is a decimal for the first character position and then a list\n of hex values representing the Unicode codes that compose that encoding.<br>\n The "simple" encoding is recommended for TrueType fonts\n as the "full" encoding risks not matching the character with the right glyph\n if not done with care.<br>\n The "full" encoding is specially aimed at Type1 fonts where the glyphs have to be\n described by non standard names like the Tex math fonts. Each group of three elements\n compose a code position: the one byte code order in decimal or as 'x' (x cannot be the space), the name and the Unicode character\n used to access the glyph. The space must be assigned to character position 32 otherwise\n text justification will not work.\n <p></p>\n Example for a "simple" encoding that includes the Unicode\n character space, A, B and ecyrillic:\n <pre>\n "# simple 32 0020 0041 0042 0454"\n </pre>\n<p></p>\n Example for a "full" encoding for a Type1 Tex font:\n <pre>\n "# full 'A' nottriangeqlleft 0041 'B' dividemultiply 0042 32 space 0020"\n </pre></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FontProgramFactory.html

HashCode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class is a convenience method to sequentially calculate hash code of the\n object based on the field values. The result depends on the order of elements\n appended. The exact formula is the same as for\n java.util.List.hashCode.\n\n If you need order independent hash code just summate, multiply or XOR all\n elements.\n\n \n Suppose we have class:\n\n \n class Thing {\n     long id;\n     String name;\n     float weight;\n }\n \n\n The hash code calculation can be expressed in 2 forms.\n\n \n For maximum performance:\n\n \n public int hashCode() {\n     int hashCode = HashCode.EMPTY_HASH_CODE;\n     hashCode = HashCode.combine(hashCode, id);\n     hashCode = HashCode.combine(hashCode, name);\n     hashCode = HashCode.combine(hashCode, weight);\n     return hashCode;\n }\n \n\n For convenience: \n public int hashCode() {\n     return new HashCode().append(id).append(name).append(weight).hashCode();\n }\n </p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/HashCode.html

HyphenationTree searchPatterns	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p>Search for all possible partial matches of word starting\n at index an update interletter values. In other words, it\n does something like:</p>\n<code>\n for(i=0; i<patterns.length; (="" )="" <="" code="" i++)="" if="" update_interletter_values(patterns[i]);="" word.substring(index).startswidth(patterns[i])="" {="" }="">\n<p>But it is done in an efficient way since the patterns are\n stored in a ternary tree. In fact, this is the whole purpose\n of having the tree: doing this search without having to test\n every single pattern. The number of patterns for languages\n such as English range from 4000 to 10000. Thus, doing thousands\n of string comparisons for each word to hyphenate would be\n really slow without the tree. The tradeoff is memory, but\n using a ternary tree instead of a trie, almost halves the\n the memory used by Lout or TeX. It's also faster than using\n a hash table</p></patterns.length;></code></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/HyphenationTree.html
HyphenationTree hyphenate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Hyphenate word and return a Hyphenation object.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/HyphenationTree.html
HyphenationTree hyphenate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Hyphenate word and return an array of hyphenation points.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/HyphenationTree.html
HyphenationTree addClass	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Add a character class to the tree. It is used by\n <a href="../../../../com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/PatternParser.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.layout.hyphenation"><code>PatternParser</code></a> as callback to\n add character classes. Character classes define the\n valid word characters for hyphenation. If a word contains\n a character not defined in any of the classes, it is not hyphenated.\n It also defines a way to normalize the characters in order\n to compare them with the stored patterns. Usually pattern\n files use only lower case characters, in this case a class\n for letter 'a', for example, should be defined as "aA", the first\n character being the normalization char.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/HyphenationTree.html
HyphenationTree addException	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Add an exception to the tree. ILargeElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A ILargeElement is a layout element which may get added to\n indefinitely, making the object prohibitively large.\n In order to avoid consuming and holding on to undesirable amounts of\n resources, the contents of a ILargeElement can be flushed regularly\n by client code, e.g. at page boundaries or after a certain amount of additions.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/ILargeElement.html

The key cannot be\n <code>null</code>. </p>\n<p>The value can be retrieved by calling the <code>get</code> method\n with a key that is equal to the original key.</p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/IntHashtable.html

ISO8601Converter parse	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Converts an ISO 8601 string to an <code>XMPDateTime</code>.\n \n Parse a date according to ISO 8601 and\n http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime:\n <ul>\n<li>YYYY\n <li>YYYY-MM\n <li>YYYY-MM-DD\n <li>YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD\n <li>YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD\n <li>YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD\n </li></li></li></li></li></li></ul>\n \n Data fields:\n <ul>\n<li>YYYY = four-digit year\n <li>MM = two-digit month (01=January, etc.)\n <li>DD = two-digit day of month (01 through 31)\n <li>hh = two digits of hour (00 through 23)\n <li>mm = two digits of minute (00 through 59)\n <li>ss = two digits of second (00 through 59)\n <li>s = one or more digits representing a decimal fraction of a second\n <li>TZD = time zone designator (Z or +hh:mm or -hh:mm)\n </li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></ul>\n \n Note that ISO 8601 does not seem to allow years less than 1000 or greater\n than 9999. We allow any year, even negative ones. The year is formatted\n as "%.4d".\n <p>\n<em>Note:</em> Tolerate missing TZD, assume is UTC. Photoshop 8 writes\n dates like this for exif:GPSTimeStamp.<br>\n<em>Note:</em> DOES NOT APPLY ANYMORE.\n Tolerate missing date portion, in case someone foolishly\n writes a time-only value that way.</br></p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/ISO8601Converter.html
ISO8601Converter	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Converts between ISO 8601 Strings and Calendar with millisecond resolution.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/ISO8601Converter.html

LayoutPosition RELATIVE	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Relative positioning is exactly like static positioning except that the left, top, right and bottom properties\n can be used to apply a translation to the object. LayoutPosition	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>We use a simplified version of CSS positioning.\n See https://www.webkit.org/blog/117/webcore-rendering-iv-absolutefixed-and-relative-positioning</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/LayoutPosition.html

Leading	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A specialized class that specifies the leading, "the vertical distance between\n the baselines of adjacent lines of text" (ISO-32000-1, section 9.3.5).\n Allows to use either an absolute (constant) leading value, or one\n determined by font size. Pronounce as 'ledding' (cfr. Led Zeppelin).\n\n This class is meant to be used as the value for the\n Property.LEADING key in an IPropertyContainer.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/Leading.html

LineSegment getBoundingRectange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><span class="deprecatedLabel">Deprecated.</span> <span class="deprecationComment">Use getBoundingRectangle(). Will be removed in 7.1</span></div><br><br><div class="block">Computes the bounding rectangle for this line segment.  The rectangle has a rotation 0 degrees\n with respect to the coordinate system that the line system is in.  For example, if a line segment\n is 5 unit long and sits at a 37 degree angle from horizontal, the bounding rectangle will have\n origin of the lower left hand end point of the segment, with width = 4 and height = 3.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/LineSegment.html

PdfAChecker checkFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Performs a number of checks on the font. See ISO 19005-1 section 6.3,\n ISO 19005-2 and ISO 19005-3 section 6.2.11.\n Be aware that not all constraints defined in the ISO are checked in this method,\n for most of them we consider that iText always creates valid fonts.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAChecker.html
PdfAChecker	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An abstract class that will run through all necessary checks defined in the\n different PDF/A standards and levels. A number of common checks are executed\n in this class, while standard-dependent specifications are implemented in the\n available subclasses. The standard that is followed is the series of ISO\n 19005 specifications, currently generations 1 through 3. The ZUGFeRD standard\n is derived from ISO 19005-3.\n \n While it is possible to subclass this method and implement its abstract\n methods in client code, this is not encouraged and will have little effect.\n It is not possible to plug custom implementations into iText, because iText\n should always refuse to create non-compliant PDF/A, which would be possible\n with client code implementations. Any future generations of the PDF/A\n standard and its derivates will get their own implementation in the\n iText 7 - pdfa project.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAChecker.html
PdfAConformanceException PdfAConformanceException	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a PdfAConformanceException.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAConformanceException.html
PdfAConformanceException	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Exception that is thrown when the PDF Document doesn't adhere to the PDF/A specification.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAConformanceException.html
PdfAConformanceLevel	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Enumeration of all the PDF/A conformance levels.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAConformanceLevel.html
PdfAcroForm SIGNATURE_EXIST	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To be used with <a href="../../../com/itextpdf/forms/PdfAcroForm.html#setSignatureFlags-int-"><code>setSignatureFlags(int)</code></a>.\n <p>\n<blockquote>\n If set, the document contains at least one signature field. This flag\n allows a conforming reader to enable user interface items (such as menu\n items or pushbuttons) related to signature processing without having to\n scan the entire document for the presence of signature fields.\n (ISO 32000-1, section 12.7.2 "Interactive Form Dictionary")\n </blockquote></p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAcroForm.html
PdfAcroForm APPEND_ONLY	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To be used with <a href="../../../com/itextpdf/forms/PdfAcroForm.html#setSignatureFlags-int-"><code>setSignatureFlags(int)</code></a>.\n <p>\n<blockquote>\n If set, the document contains signatures that may be invalidated if the\n file is saved (written) in a way that alters its previous contents, as\n opposed to an incremental update. Merely updating the file by appending\n new information to the end of the previous version is safe. Conforming\n readers may use this flag to inform a user requesting a full save that\n signatures will be invalidated and require explicit confirmation before\n continuing with the operation.\n (ISO 32000-1, section 12.7.2 "Interactive Form Dictionary")\n </blockquote></p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAcroForm.html

PdfAcroForm setDefaultResources	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the <code>DR</code> dictionary property on the AcroForm.\n <p>\n<blockquote>\n<code>DR</code> is a resource dictionary containing default resources\n (such as fonts, patterns, or colour spaces) that shall be used by form\n field appearance streams. PdfAcroForm getDefaultResources	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Gets the <code>DR</code> dictionary property on the AcroForm.\n <p>\n<blockquote>\n<code>DR</code> is a resource dictionary containing default resources\n (such as fonts, patterns, or colour spaces) that shall be used by form\n field appearance streams. PdfAcroForm setGenerateAppearance	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the attribute generateAppearance, which tells <a href="../../../com/itextpdf/forms/PdfAcroForm.html#flattenFields--"><code>flattenFields()</code></a>\n to generate an appearance Stream for all <a href="../../../com/itextpdf/forms/fields/PdfFormField.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.forms.fields"><code>form field</code></a>s\n that don't have one.\n <p>\n Not generating appearances will speed up form flattening but the results\n can be unexpected in Acrobat. Don't use it unless your environment is\n well controlled. The default is <code>true</code>.\n <p>\n If generateAppearance is set to <code>true</code>, then\n <code>NeedAppearances</code> is set to <code>false</code>. This does not\n apply vice versa.</p></p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAcroForm.html

PdfAcroForm isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><span class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></span></div><br><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the\n resultant document.\n <br><br>\n If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object\n must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that\n when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into\n indirect object if it's not indirect yet.\n <br><br>\n Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return\n always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAcroForm.html

PdfADocument	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class extends PdfDocument and is in charge of creating files\n that comply with the PDF/A standard.\n \n Client code is still responsible for making sure the file is actually PDF/A\n compliant: multiple steps must be undertaken (depending on the\n PdfAConformanceLevel) to ensure that the PDF/A standard is followed.\n \n This class will throw exceptions, mostly PdfAConformanceException, \n and thus refuse to output a PDF/A file if at any point the document does not\n adhere to the PDF/A guidelines specified by the PdfAConformanceLevel.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfADocument.html

PdfAnnotation getFlags	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">A set of flags specifying various characteristics of the annotation (see ISO-320001 12.5.3, âAnnotation Flagsâ).\n For specific annotation flag constants see <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#setFlag-int-"><code>setFlag(int)</code></a>.\n Default value: 0.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html
PdfAnnotation setFlags	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets a set of flags specifying various characteristics of the annotation (see ISO-320001 12.5.3, âAnnotation Flagsâ).\n On the contrary from <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#setFlag-int-"><code>setFlag(int)</code></a>, this method sets a complete set of enabled and disabled flags at once.\n If not set specifically the default value is 0.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html
PdfAnnotation setFlag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets a flag that specifies a characteristic of the annotation to enabled state (see ISO-320001 12.5.3, âAnnotation Flagsâ).\n On the contrary from <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#setFlags-int-"><code>setFlags(int)</code></a>, this method sets only specified flags to enabled state,\n but doesn't disable other flags.\n Possible flags:\n <ul>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#INVISIBLE"><code>INVISIBLE</code></a> - If set, do not display the annotation if it does not belong to one of the\n     standard annotation types and no annotation handler is available. If clear, display such unknown annotation\n     using an appearance stream specified by its appearance dictionary, if any.\n     </li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#HIDDEN"><code>HIDDEN</code></a> - If set, do not display or print the annotation or allow it to interact with\n     the user, regardless of its annotation type or whether an annotation handler is available.\n     </li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#PRINT"><code>PRINT</code></a> - If set, print the annotation when the page is printed. If clear, never print\n     the annotation, regardless of whether it is displayed on the screen.\n     </li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#NO_ZOOM"><code>NO_ZOOM</code></a> - If set, do not scale the annotationâs appearance to match the magnification of\n     the page. The location of the annotation on the page (defined by the upper-left corner of its annotation\n     rectangle) shall remain fixed, regardless of the page magnification.}\n     </li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#NO_ROTATE"><code>NO_ROTATE</code></a> - If set, do not rotate the annotationâs appearance to match the rotation\n     of the page. The upper-left corner of the annotation rectangle shall remain in a fixed location on the page,\n     regardless of the page rotation.\n     </li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#NO_VIEW"><code>NO_VIEW</code></a> - If set, do not display the annotation on the screen or allow it to interact\n     with the user. The annotation may be printed (depending on the setting of the Print flag) but should be considered\n     hidden for purposes of on-screen display and user interaction.\n     </li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#READ_ONLY"><code>READ_ONLY</code></a> -  If set, do not allow the annotation to interact with the user. The annotation\n     may be displayed or printed (depending on the settings of the NoView and Print flags) but should not respond to mouse\n     clicks or change its appearance in response to mouse motions.\n     </li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#LOCKED"><code>LOCKED</code></a> -  If set, do not allow the annotation to be deleted or its properties\n     (including position and size) to be modified by the user. However, this flag does not restrict changes to\n     the annotationâs contents, such as the value of a form field.\n     </li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#TOGGLE_NO_VIEW"><code>TOGGLE_NO_VIEW</code></a> - If set, invert the interpretation of the NoView flag for certain events.\n     </li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#LOCKED_CONTENTS"><code>LOCKED_CONTENTS</code></a> - If set, do not allow the contents of the annotation to be modified\n     by the user. This flag does not restrict deletion of the annotation or changes to other annotation properties,\n     such as position and size.\n     </li>\n</ul></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html

PdfAnnotation getBorder	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><p>\n An array specifying the characteristics of the annotationâs border.\n The array consists of three numbers defining the horizontal corner radius,\n vertical corner radius, and border width, all in default user space units.\n If the corner radii are 0, the border has square (not rounded) corners; if\n the border width is 0, no border is drawn.\n <p>\n The array may have a fourth element, an optional dash array (see ISO-320001 8.4.3.6, âLine Dash Patternâ).</p></p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html

PdfAnnotation getOpen	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">A flag specifying whether the annotation shall initially be displayed open.\n This flag has affect to not all kinds of annotations.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html
PdfAnnotation setOpen	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets a flag specifying whether the annotation shall initially be displayed open.\n This flag has affect to not all kinds of annotations.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html
PdfAnnotation getQuadPoints	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">An array of 8 Ã n numbers specifying the coordinates of n quadrilaterals in default user space.\n Quadrilaterals are used to define:\n <ul>\n<li>regions inside annotation rectangle in which the link annotation should be activated;</li>\n<li>a word or group of contiguous words in the text underlying the text markup annotation;</li>\n<li>the content region that is intended to be removed for a redaction annotation;</li>\n</ul>\n<p>\n IMPORTANT NOTE: According to Table 179 in ISO 32000-1, the QuadPoints array lists the vertices in counterclockwise\n order and the text orientation is defined by the first and second vertex. This basically means QuadPoints is\n specified as lower-left, lower-right, top-right, top-left. HOWEVER, Adobe's interpretation\n (tested at least with Acrobat 10, Acrobat 11, Reader 11) is top-left, top-right, lower-left, lower-right (Z-shaped order).\n This means that if the QuadPoints array is specified according to the standard, the rendering is not as expected.\n Other viewers seem to follow Adobe's interpretation. Hence we recommend to use and expect QuadPoints array in Z-order,\n just as Acrobat and probably most other viewers expect.</p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html
PdfAnnotation setQuadPoints	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets n quadrilaterals in default user space by passing an <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfArray.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf"><code>PdfArray</code></a> of 8 Ã n numbers. For more info of what\n quadrilaterals define see <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getQuadPoints--"><code>getQuadPoints()</code></a>.\n\n <p>\n IMPORTANT NOTE: According to Table 179 in ISO 32000-1, the QuadPoints array lists the vertices in counterclockwise\n order and the text orientation is defined by the first and second vertex. This basically means QuadPoints is\n specified as lower-left, lower-right, top-right, top-left. HOWEVER, Adobe's interpretation\n (tested at least with Acrobat 10, Acrobat 11, Reader 11) is top-left, top-right, lower-left, lower-right (Z-shaped order).\n This means that if the QuadPoints array is specified according to the standard, the rendering is not as expected.\n Other viewers seem to follow Adobe's interpretation. Hence we recommend to use and expect QuadPoints array in Z-order,\n just as Acrobat and probably most other viewers expect.</p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html
PdfAnnotation setBorderStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets border style dictionary that has more settings than the array specified for the Border entry (<a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getBorder--"><code>getBorder()</code></a>).\n See ISO-320001, Table 166 and <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getBorderStyle--"><code>getBorderStyle()</code></a> for more info.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html
PdfAnnotation setBorderStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Setter for the annotation's preset border style. Possible values are\n <ul>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#STYLE_SOLID"><code>STYLE_SOLID</code></a> - A solid rectangle surrounding the annotation.</li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#STYLE_DASHED"><code>STYLE_DASHED</code></a> - A dashed rectangle surrounding the annotation.</li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#STYLE_BEVELED"><code>STYLE_BEVELED</code></a> - A simulated embossed rectangle that appears to be raised above the surface of the page.</li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#STYLE_INSET"><code>STYLE_INSET</code></a> - A simulated engraved rectangle that appears to be recessed below the surface of the page.</li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#STYLE_UNDERLINE"><code>STYLE_UNDERLINE</code></a> - A single line along the bottom of the annotation rectangle.</li>\n</ul>\n See also ISO-320001, Table 166.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html

PdfAnnotation getBorderStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">The dictionaries for some annotation types (such as free text and polygon annotations) can include the BS entry.\n That entry specifies a border style dictionary that has more settings than the array specified for the Border\n entry (see <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getBorder--"><code>getBorder()</code></a>). If an annotation dictionary includes the BS entry, then the Border\n entry is ignored. If annotation includes AP (see <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getAppearanceDictionary--"><code>getAppearanceDictionary()</code></a>) it takes\n precedence over the BS entry. PdfAnnotation flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure\n that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference.\n Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#makeIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-"><code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code></a>.\n For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush();\n Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html

This pieslice-shaped\n figure is filled in, producing a rounded corner.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfCanvasConstants.LineJoinStyle.html
PdfCanvasConstants.LineJoinStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The line join style specifies the shape to be used at the corners of\n paths that are stroked. Join styles are significant only at points where\n consecutive segments of a path connect at an angle; segments that meet or\n intersect fortuitously receive no special treatment.\n \n All documentation for this class is taken from ISO 32000-1, section\n 8.4.3.4 "Line Join Style".</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfCanvasConstants.LineJoinStyle.html

PdfCanvasConstants.TextRenderingMode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The text rendering mode determines whether showing text causes glyph\n outlines to be stroked, filled, used as a clipping boundary, or some\n combination of the three. Stroking, filling, and clipping have the same\n effects for a text object as they do for a path object, although they are\n specified in an entirely different way.\n \n If the text rendering mode calls for filling, the current nonstroking\n color in the graphics state is used; if it calls for stroking, the\n current stroking color is used.\n \n All documentation for this class is taken from ISO 32000-1, section 9.3.6\n "Text Rendering Mode".</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfCanvasConstants.TextRenderingMode.html
PdfCanvasParser PdfCanvasParser	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Creates a new instance of PdfContentParser</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfCanvasParser.html
PdfCanvasParser parse	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Parses a single command from the content. Each command is output as an array of arguments\n having the command itself as the last element. The returned array will be empty if the\n end of content was reached.\n <br>\n A specific behaviour occurs when inline image is encountered (BI command):\n in that case, parser would continue parsing until it meets EI - end of the inline image;\n as a result in this case it will return an array with inline image dictionary and image bytes\n encapsulated in PdfStream object as first element and EI command as second element.</br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfCanvasParser.html

PdfDate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>PdfDate is the PDF date object.\n \n PDF defines a standard date format. The PDF date format closely follows the format\n defined by the international standard ASN.1 (Abstract Syntax Notation One, defined\n in CCITT X.208 or ISO/IEC 8824). A date is a PdfString of the form:\n \n (D:YYYYMMDDHHmmSSOHH'mm')\n \n This object is described in the 'Portable Document Format Reference Manual version 1.3'\n section 7.2 (page 183-184)</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfDate.html

PdfDeveloperExtension	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Beginning with BaseVersion 1.7, the extensions dictionary lets developers\n designate that a given document contains extensions to PDF. The presence\n of the extension dictionary in a document indicates that it may contain\n developer-specific PDF properties that extend a particular base version\n of the PDF specification.\n The extensions dictionary enables developers to identify their own extensions\n relative to a base version of PDF. Additionally, the convention identifies\n extension levels relative to that base version. The intent of this dictionary\n is to enable developers of PDF-producing applications to identify company-specific\n specifications (such as this one) that PDF-consuming applications use to\n interpret the extensions.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfDeveloperExtension.html

PdfDictionary	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A representation of a Dictionary as described by the PDF Specification. A Dictionary is a mapping between keys\n and values. Keys are PdfNames and the values are\n PdfObjects. Each key can only be associated with one value and\n adding a new value to an existing key will override the previous value. A value of null should be ignored when\n the PdfDocument is closed.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfDictionary.html

PdfFormField isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><span class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class: <code><a href="../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--">PdfObjectWrapper</a></code></span></div><br><br><div class="block">Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the\n resultant document.\n <br><br>\n If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object\n must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that\n when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into\n indirect object if it's not indirect yet.\n <br><br>\n Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return\n always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfFormField.html

PdfImageXObject identifyImageType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Identifies the type of the image that is stored in the bytes of this <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/xobject/PdfImageXObject.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.xobject"><code>PdfImageXObject</code></a>.\n Note that this has nothing to do with the original type of the image. For instance, the return value\n of this method will never be <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/io/image/ImageType.html#PNG"><code>ImageType.PNG</code></a> as we loose this information when converting a\n PNG image into something that can be put into a PDF file.\n The possible values are: <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/io/image/ImageType.html#JPEG"><code>ImageType.JPEG</code></a>, <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/io/image/ImageType.html#JPEG2000"><code>ImageType.JPEG2000</code></a>, <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/io/image/ImageType.html#JBIG2"><code>ImageType.JBIG2</code></a>,\n <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/io/image/ImageType.html#TIFF"><code>ImageType.TIFF</code></a>, <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/io/image/ImageType.html#PNG"><code>ImageType.PNG</code></a></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfImageXObject.html

Possible values are AllOn, AnyOn, AnyOff and AllOff.\n AllOn - Visible only if all of the entries are <b>ON</b>.\n AnyOn - Visible if any of the entries are <b>ON</b>.\n AnyOff - Visible if any of the entries are <b>OFF</b>.\n AllOff - Visible only if all of the entries are <b>OFF</b>.\n The default value is AnyOn.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLayerMembership.html

PdfLayerMembership	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Content typically belongs to a single optional content group,\n and is visible when the group is ON and invisible when it is OFF. To express more\n complex visibility policies, content should not declare itself to belong to an optional\n content group directly, but rather to an optional content membership dictionary\n represented by this class.\n\n \n To be able to be wrapped with this PdfObjectWrapper the PdfObject\n must be indirect.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLayerMembership.html

PdfLineAnnotation getSubtype	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Gets a <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf"><code>PdfName</code></a> which value is a subtype of this annotation.\n See ISO-320001 12.5.6, âAnnotation Typesâ for the reference to the possible types.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation getLine	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">An array of four numbers, [x1 y1 x2 y2], specifying the starting and ending coordinates of the line\n in default user space. If the <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#LL"><code>PdfName.LL</code></a> (see <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLeaderLine--"><code>getLeaderLine()</code></a>) entry is present, this value represents\n the endpoints of the leader lines rather than the endpoints of the line itself.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation getLineEndingStyles	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">An array of two names specifying the line ending styles that is used in drawing the line.\n The first and second elements of the array shall specify the line ending styles for the endpoints defined,\n respectively, by the first and second pairs of coordinates, (x1, y1) and (x2, y2), in the <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#L"><code>PdfName.L</code></a> array\n (see <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLine--"><code>getLine()</code></a>. For possible values see <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#setLineEndingStyles-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfArray-"><code>setLineEndingStyles(PdfArray)</code></a>.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation setLineEndingStyles	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the line ending styles that are used in drawing the line.\n The first and second elements of the array shall specify the line ending styles for the endpoints defined,\n respectively, by the first and second pairs of coordinates, (x1, y1) and (x2, y2), in the <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#L"><code>PdfName.L</code></a> array\n (see <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLine--"><code>getLine()</code></a>. Possible values for styles are:\n <ul>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Square"><code>PdfName.Square</code></a> - A square filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; </li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Circle"><code>PdfName.Circle</code></a> - A circle filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; </li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Diamond"><code>PdfName.Diamond</code></a> - A diamond shape filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; </li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#OpenArrow"><code>PdfName.OpenArrow</code></a> - Two short lines meeting in an acute angle to form an open arrowhead; </li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#ClosedArrow"><code>PdfName.ClosedArrow</code></a> - Two short lines meeting in an acute angle as in the <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#OpenArrow"><code>PdfName.OpenArrow</code></a> style and\n     connected by a third line to form a triangular closed arrowhead filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; </li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#None"><code>PdfName.None</code></a> - No line ending; </li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Butt"><code>PdfName.Butt</code></a> - A short line at the endpoint perpendicular to the line itself; </li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#ROpenArrow"><code>PdfName.ROpenArrow</code></a> - Two short lines in the reverse direction from <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#OpenArrow"><code>PdfName.OpenArrow</code></a>; </li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#RClosedArrow"><code>PdfName.RClosedArrow</code></a> - A triangular closed arrowhead in the reverse direction from <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#ClosedArrow"><code>PdfName.ClosedArrow</code></a>; </li>\n<li><a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Slash"><code>PdfName.Slash</code></a> - A short line at the endpoint approximately 30 degrees clockwise from perpendicular to the line itself; </li>\n</ul>\n see also ISO-320001, Table 176 "Line ending styles".</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation getLeaderLine	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><span class="deprecatedLabel">Deprecated.</span> <span class="deprecationComment">use <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLeaderLineLength--"><code>getLeaderLineLength()</code></a> instead.</span></div><br><br><div class="block">The length of leader lines in default user space that extend from each endpoint of the line perpendicular\n to the line itself. A positive value means that the leader lines appear in the direction that is clockwise\n when traversing the line from its starting point to its ending point (as specified by <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#L"><code>PdfName.L</code></a> (see <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLine--"><code>getLine()</code></a>);\n a negative value indicates the opposite direction.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation setLeaderLine	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block"><span class="deprecatedLabel">Deprecated.</span> <span class="deprecationComment">use <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#setLeaderLineLength-float-"><code>setLeaderLineLength(float)</code></a> instead.</span></div><br><br><div class="block">Sets the length of leader lines in default user space that extend from each endpoint of the line perpendicular\n to the line itself. A positive value means that the leader lines appear in the direction that is clockwise\n when traversing the line from its starting point to its ending point (as specified by <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#L"><code>PdfName.L</code></a> (see <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLine--"><code>getLine()</code></a>);\n a negative value indicates the opposite direction.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation getLeaderLineLength	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">The length of leader lines in default user space that extend from each endpoint of the line perpendicular\n to the line itself. A positive value means that the leader lines appear in the direction that is clockwise\n when traversing the line from its starting point to its ending point (as specified by <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#L"><code>PdfName.L</code></a> (see <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLine--"><code>getLine()</code></a>);\n a negative value indicates the opposite direction.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation setLeaderLineLength	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the length of leader lines in default user space that extend from each endpoint of the line perpendicular\n to the line itself. A positive value means that the leader lines appear in the direction that is clockwise\n when traversing the line from its starting point to its ending point (as specified by <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#L"><code>PdfName.L</code></a> (see <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLine--"><code>getLine()</code></a>);\n a negative value indicates the opposite direction.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation getLeaderLineExtension	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">A non-negative number that represents the length of leader line extensions that extend from the line proper\n 180 degrees from the leader lines.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation setLeaderLineExtension	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets the length of leader line extensions that extend from the line proper 180 degrees from the leader lines.\n <b>This value shall not be set unless <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#LL"><code>PdfName.LL</code></a> (see <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#setLeaderLine-float-"><code>setLeaderLine(float)</code></a>) is set.</b></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html

PdfLineAnnotation getContentsAsCaption	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">If true, the text specified by the <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Contents"><code>PdfName.Contents</code></a> or <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#RC"><code>PdfName.RC</code></a> entries\n (see <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getContents--"><code>PdfAnnotation.getContents()</code></a> and <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html#getRichText--"><code>PdfMarkupAnnotation.getRichText()</code></a>)\n is replicated as a caption in the appearance of the line.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation setContentsAsCaption	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">If set to true, the text specified by the <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Contents"><code>PdfName.Contents</code></a> or <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#RC"><code>PdfName.RC</code></a> entries\n (see <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfAnnotation.html#getContents--"><code>PdfAnnotation.getContents()</code></a> and <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html#getRichText--"><code>PdfMarkupAnnotation.getRichText()</code></a>)\n will be replicated as a caption in the appearance of the line.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html

Valid values are <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Inline"><code>PdfName.Inline</code></a>, meaning the caption\n is centered inside the line, and <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Top"><code>PdfName.Top</code></a>, meaning the caption is on top of the line.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html

The second value is the vertical\n offset perpendicular to the annotation line, with a positive value indicating a shift up and a negative value indicating\n a shift down.</div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html

PdfMarkupAnnotation setIntent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">Sets a name describing the intent of the markup annotation.\n Intents allow conforming readers to distinguish between different uses and behaviors\n of a single markup annotation type. If this entry is not present or its value is the same as the annotation type,\n the annotation shall have no explicit intent and should behave in a generic manner in a conforming reader.\n <p>\n See ISO-320001, free text annotations (Table 174), line annotations (Table 175), polygon annotations (Table 178),\n and polyline annotations (Table 178) for the specific intent values for those types.\n </p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html

The only defined value is <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfName.html#Markup3D"><code>PdfName.Markup3D</code></a>. PdfMarkupAnnotation setRectangleDifferences	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">A set of four numbers describing the numerical differences between two rectangles:\n the Rect entry of the annotation and another rectangle within that one, which\n meaning depends on the type of the annotation:\n <ul>\n<li> for <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfFreeTextAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot"><code>PdfFreeTextAnnotation</code></a> the inner rectangle is where the annotation's text should be displayed;</li>\n<li>\n         for <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfSquareAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot"><code>PdfSquareAnnotation</code></a> and <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfCircleAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot"><code>PdfCircleAnnotation</code></a> the inner rectangle is the actual boundaries\n         of the underlying square or circle;\n     </li>\n<li> for <a href="../../../../../com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfCaretAnnotation.html" title="class in com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot"><code>PdfCaretAnnotation</code></a> the inner rectangle is the actual boundaries of the underlying caret.</li>\n</ul></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html

PdfMarkupAnnotation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This is a super class for the annotations which are defined as markup annotations\n because they are used primarily to mark up PDF documents. These annotations have\n text that appears as part of the annotation and may be displayed in other ways\n by a conforming reader, such as in a Comments pane.\n See also ISO-320001 12.5.6.2 "Markup Annotations".</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html

PdfPKCS7 getAuthenticatedAttributeBytes	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><div class="block">When using authenticatedAttributes the authentication process is different.\n The document digest is generated and put inside the attribute. The signing is done over the DER encoded\n authenticatedAttributes. This method provides that encoding and the parameters must be\n exactly the same as in <a href="../../../com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfPKCS7.html#getEncodedPKCS7-byte:A-"><code>getEncodedPKCS7(byte[])</code></a>.\n <p>\n A simple example:\n <p>\n<pre>\n Calendar cal = Calendar.getInstance();\n PdfPKCS7 pk7 = new PdfPKCS7(key, chain, null, "SHA1", null, false);\n MessageDigest messageDigest = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA1");\n byte[] buf = new byte[8192];\n int n;\n InputStream inp = sap.getRangeStream();\n while ((n = inp.read(buf)) &gt; 0) {\n    messageDigest.update(buf, 0, n);\n }\n byte[] hash = messageDigest.digest();\n byte[] sh = pk7.getAuthenticatedAttributeBytes(hash, cal);\n pk7.update(sh, 0, sh.length);\n byte[] sg = pk7.getEncodedPKCS7(hash, cal);\n </pre></p></p></div></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfPKCS7.html
